turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: Forget the Jewish stuff. It doesn't play anymore.  There's only the market, now, and it doesn't care who you are.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: People still need values, beliefs....

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: No, they don't. Not the smart ones.  Look, I'll give you five grand if you can document your tax-exempt status.... But when you fall off this horse, come see me. I can show you how to make a lot of money.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't care about money.

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: You will.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're a Jew. Maybe you don't realize it, but you are.

turns.speaker: BRAND
turns.text: Maybe I am. Maybe we're all Jews now. What's the difference?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Have you read Toynbee? Spengler?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Nobody reads that stuff anymore.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Too difficult?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Too Christian. You know Jameson? Paul Virilio?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The point is, the modern world is a Jewish disease.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Disease? What disease?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Abstraction. They're obsessed with abstraction.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Which is what?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: At first, no one will know why the victims are being killed.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You're not in school? What do you do?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I work at the Big Boy warehouse. In Queens. I drive a fork-lift.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Where'd you read all that stuff?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I just read it....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Why no silencer?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You want it to be an event.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: "...und die Worte zerfielen mir im Munde wie modrige Pilze..."

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: "And the words fell apart in my mouth like moldering mushrooms..."

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How come so many of the books are in Spanish?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: They're my father's. He's from Argentina. My mother's family went there during the war. That's where they met.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Are they still together?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: He's in a mental institution.... He's been there for ten years, off and on. Mostly on.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Is he a Nazi?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I guess. His parents are. He doesn't care about that.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What's he care about?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Killing himself.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You think people ever commit suicide out of happiness?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: That's stupid. Why would they?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You're not like the others, are you?... Your friends.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes, I am. Basically I am.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I bet. He didn't realize that nobody who talks such a good game ever plays one.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You weren't complaining about my play last time.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Too many good players down here. I'm with one right now.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh, really?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Bigger and better.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then how come you're talking to me?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Who's Linda?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why won't you talk to me?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I'm talking to you right now. Who's Linda?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: When can I see you?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You can't.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Your father??

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: He's at a home out here.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm coming to your room tonight.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Where'd you get this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I stole it. From a synagogue.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: How come there's no punctuation?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That was a later invention, it's not in the scrolls.... Anyway, the Jews know where the sentences end. They know the whole thing by heart. Every word. Every letter.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Do you know it like that? By heart.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: But you can read it, the Hebrew.... Right?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What do you care?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: 'Cause I want to know.... What is this word? This one here...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Va-yomer... And he said.  It goes the other way.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Oh, yeah...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Va-yomer adonai el Avram: lech lecha mayartzcha oo-mimohlad-tcha oo-m'bayt avaycha el ha-ertez asher arecha...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's it mean?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And God said to Avram, take yourself away from your land and from the place you were born and from your father's house into the land -- a different land -- and I will show you....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I want to learn to read it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Know your enemy.... 'Cause it's a basic text of Western culture. I want to read it in the original. Okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hebrew's very difficult. It would take years.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I'm good at languages.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Put something on. You're not supposed to be naked in front of it.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They think it's the word of God, and it's holy, and the flesh isn't....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: That's stupid.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, it's stupid.  Put it on, or I won't teach you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: See, the Jews love to separate things: the holy from the profane, milk from meat, wool from linen, the Sabbath from the week, the Jew from the gentile.... As if one little scrap of this was going to completely contaminate that.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What assholes.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You can't curse in front of it either.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Who gets contaminated, the Jews or the gentiles?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Good question. Both.  Aleph...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: It looks a little like a swastika.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's silent. It holds a place, takes a vowel. The vowels are little dots that go under the letters.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They don't put them in the Torah. I'll get you a chumash, they'll have them there...Bet...Gimel...Dalid...Hay...  How come you're here instead of with Curtis? Besides the Hebrew lessons...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: The sex is better.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Even though his dick is so big?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: With you there's a tragic dimension.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Vuv...Zayin...Chet...Tet...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Payn tash-chiton v'ashiytem...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: V'asitem...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: V'asitem lechem pessel to-monat. And make no graven image of the Lord, or the form of any figure, or of man or woman, or beast or fowl or fish or anything that looks like anything. Because He's not like anything. Not only can't you see Him or hear Him, you can't even think about Him. I mean, what's the difference between that and Him not existing?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No difference.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Christianity's silly, but at least there's something to believe in. Or not believe. Judaism there's nothing.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nothing but nothingness...Judaism's not about belief.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: What's it about?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: About doing things. You light candles, say prayers, keep the Sabbath, visit the sick....

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: And belief follows?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No. Nothing follows. You don't do it because it's smart or stupid or it saves your soul. You're not saved. Nobody's saved. You do it because the Torah tells you do. You submit to the Torah.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Fuck that.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't curse in front of it.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Why should I submit?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You shouldn't.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You think I should just because there's no reason?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, I think you shouldn't.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Judaism doesn't even need God. You have the Torah, the law. That's your fucking God....  The book's closed.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're learning the Hebrew really fast.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I told you, I'm good at this.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Plus you have nothing else to do all day.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Oh, am I learning it faster than you did? Maybe I'm smarter.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What...? You think I'm Jewish?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: It's all you talk about. Jewish, Jewish, Jewish. Nobody talks about it that much except the Jews.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nazis talk about it all the time.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Do they?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The real Nazis. Hitler, Goebbels, they talked about Jews incessantly.... You ever read their diaries?...

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Is that why you became a Nazi? So you could talk about Jews incessantly?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Believe me, Adolf Hitler couldn't possibly have hated the Jews as much as I do. Not in a billion years. You know why?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: 'Cause he wasn't a rabbi.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You want a punch in the mouth?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Okay...  Why don't we light candles on Friday? Let's light candles.... And say the kaddish.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Kaddish is the prayer for the dead.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I mean kiddush. Let's say kiddush. And shave my head, fuck through a sheet, all that stuff...  Come on, just for fun. To see what it's like...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You can't. Do you know how many people I've brought into...the movement...?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Lina, come here!

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Come on, we can be like Eichmann. He studied Torah. He hated Jews.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Is it like Eichmann? Are we goofing?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: I don't know. I just want to try it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Shit...  Did you talk to your mother today?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: No. What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nothing.  Why are you doing this?  I thought God didn't exist.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: He commands it whether He exists or not...  Look, we can fight him and be crushed. Or we can submit.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And be crushed.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Yeah, okay. But what if...what if... submitting...being crushed, being nothing, not mattering, what if that's the best feeling we can have?

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Look, just light the candles with me. Then we'll eat. You have to eat.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You eat first, then you light.  Once you light, it's Yom Kippur, which means you're fasting, so you can't...eat.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: Miriam called, looking for you. She said you might come, so I...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You gotta get out of here.

turns.speaker: CARLA
turns.text: You don't own this place.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Carla?... It's me, Danny...Danny Balint...? We met at that...[meeting at your house.]

turns.speaker: CARLA'S VOICE
turns.text: Yeah, I remember.... Kill any Jews yet?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I didn't realize you cared.

turns.speaker: CARLA'S VOICE
turns.text: I don't. I was just curious how full of shit you were.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Did you know that there was a New York Times reporter there that night?

turns.speaker: CARLA'S VOICE
turns.text: Really, which one? I bet it was the guy with the Prada shoes.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I didn't notice his shoes.... Did your mother know he was there?

turns.speaker: CARLA'S VOICE
turns.text: I doubt it. How did you find out?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: He called me up. He wanted to talk to me about my ideas.

turns.speaker: CARLA'S VOICE
turns.text: That's a much easier game.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why don't you come visit, we'll have a rematch.

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: I thought there were people here....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'll go look....

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: Who's Eichmann?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who's Eichmann?!!?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Shema yisrael adonai elohenu adonai echod.

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nothing. Let's go....

turns.speaker: CARLETON
turns.text: Why are you taking that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm stealing it.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: ...I thought we agreed, no anti- Semitism...it's exactly what we're trying to put behind us.... Trash the blacks, fine; but...

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: Did you see how they reacted to him?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Yes, of course. But that only plays in this room, with people who aren't embarrassed to call themselves Nazis. If you want a modern fascism, you don't mention Jews.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: It's a romantic movement, Curtis. It always has been.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Lina, the Thousand-Year Reich barely lasted a decade.... Do you really want to go down that road again? In America of all places, where obedience and discipline are not exactly the national virtues...

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: An investment banking house.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: He's Jewish? Manzetti?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Danny, the night we met, you said the name Ilio Manzetti. We were impressed. We were excited. But here it is September, and Mr. Manzetti is still walking around breathing the air.

turns.speaker: MRS. MOEBIUS
turns.text: We need intellectuals, we have enough thugs already.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: More cultural than political.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Obviously.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Decentralized, nonviolent, increasingly mainstream. We'll see antiabortion, anti-immigration groups form alliances with the gun lobby, Christian identity types, tax resisters and even some libertarians....

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: That would be a catastrophic mistake.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: People hate Jews. Do you agree?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: They used to. Today it's not an issue.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, but deep down, beneath the "tolerance" they learn on television, nothing's changed. The very word makes their skin crawl.  It isn't even hate, really. It's more the way we feel when a rat runs across the floor. We want to step on it. Crush it. We don't even know why. It's a physical reaction. Everyone feels it.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: You wouldn't announce it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'd say nothing. After two or three, people will try to find a pattern. A reason.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: But when it comes out, the public will be outraged. It will look like Germany all over again.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Isn't that what we want? Germany all over again? Only done right this time...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Totally. The family emigrated from Bulgaria when he was eleven.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: How would you kill him?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'd have to research it, study his routines, his security.... But ideally on a New York street at midday, using a small-caliber automatic without a silencer.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: ...Insulting people who were in the camps. ...What's the point?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They're liars and cowards.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: I'm sure they are. But what do we accomplish by pointing it out?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's the truth....

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: Leo Strauss...  I've got to go to Boston. I came to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about Mrs. Moebius and...?

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: They left an hour ago.  You mind some personal advice? Forget Carla. That's not the side your bread's buttered on.  How soon can you get back to the city?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: A week or so. There's something I want to do here first.

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: What's that?  Okay. Surprise us...

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: We want to build bridges to certain positions in the political mainstream: works like The Bell Curve, Sociobiology, anti-Zionism, anti- immigration, the com-munitarian issue.... We'll hold conferences: invite liberals, blacks, Jews. Chomsky, Cockburn, Stanley Crouch, Shahack....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I've been waiting all my life for something like this.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about...Manzetti, the synagogues....

turns.speaker: CURTIS
turns.text: That doesn't seem to be happening, does it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I've been stuck out in the country with those guys who just want to paint swastikas and heil Hitler. How am I supposed to --

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Is it okay if I record this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No... Yeah, fine, go ahead... So what's this about? Is this about me?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: I'm trying to figure out where the radical right is going to next....I thought you were the most interesting person at that meeting.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about Curtis Zampf?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Curtis is a politician -- and a bit of a hustler. He's not a thinker.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: The other night you said the modern world is a Jewish disease. Could you elaborate on that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: In the movement -- the racialist movement -- we believe there's a hierarchy of the races. Not just in IQ, but in the civilization, the art, the forms of government, the civilizations that each race produces... Why are you writing this down if you're recording it?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: It helps me concentrate.... So does that mean you're a white supremacist?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What should I be, a white inferior- ist? A multicultural Zulu egalitarian? Let me ask, where are your people from?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: My mother's family is French, my father's was German, originally.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: German. Mine, too. So who do you think's given more to the world, the Germans -- Beethoven, Goethe, Nietzsche -- or the entire continent of Africa? Ibos, Bantus, Mandingos...

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Danny, what about the Jews?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Jews are different.... Blacks are disgusting and inferior, but it's like criticizing a retarded child. The Jews are...a poison in the human well....

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: A poison...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Let me give you an example.... Sexuality.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Sexuality??? What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You ever fuck a Jewish girl?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: What??!?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Did you ever fuck one, Guy?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: What's that go to do with...I've gone out with a, with Jewish women. Why?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And? WHat did you notice?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Notice? Like what...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Jewish girls like to give head, right?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: I don't know. Is that right?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: And Jewish men like to get it.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Everybody likes to, don't they?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes. It's very pleasurable. But the Jews are obsessed with it. You know why?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Because the Jew is essentially female.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Female...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Real men -- white, Christian men -- we fuck a woman. We make her come with our cocks. But the Jew doesn't like to penetrate and thrust -- he can't assert himself that directly -- so he resorts to perversions. Oral sex is technically a perversion, you know that, don't you?  After a woman has been with a Jewish man, she never wants a normal partner again. A normal man.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Does that mean the Jew is the better lover?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're not listening. He isn't better. He gives pleasure, but that's actually a weakness.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Danny, what makes you think you know all this?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Let's just say I've done due diligence.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: So, fine, it's not that the Jew, the Jews own the media and the banks. It's that they're sexually corrupt.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Jews clearly control the media and the banks. Investment banks, not the commercial ones. But the point is they carry out in those realms the same principles they display in sexuality. They undermine traditional life; they deracinate society.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Deracinate... Tear out the roots. A people -- a real people -- derives its genius from the land: the sun, the sea, the soil. This is how they know themselves. But the Jew doesn't have soil.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: He has Israel.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Those aren't Jews.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Of course they're Jews.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Notice the Israelis: a fundamentally secular society. They no longer need Judaism because they have soil. The real Jew is a wanderer, a nomad. He has no roots, no attachments. So he "universalizes" everything. He can't hammer a nail, plow a field. He can only buy and sell, invest capital, manipulate markets. He takes the life of a people rooted in soil and turns it into a cosmopolitan culture based on books, ideas, numbers. This is his strength....  Take the great Jewish minds: Marx, Freud, Einstein. What have they given us: communism, infantile sexuality and the atom bomb. In a mere three centuries since these guys emerged from the ghettos of Europe, they've taken us from a world built on order and reason and hurled us into a chaos of class warfare, irrational urges and relativity, a world where the very existence of matter and meaning is in doubt. Why? Because it is the deepest impulse of the Jewish soul to unravel the very fabric of life until nothing is left but thread, nothing but nothingness. Nothingness without end...

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Are all Jews the same?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Differences exist, of course, but they're irrelevant. For the Jew, his Jewishness dominates everything. Even the ones who renounce it, who hate it, who want to cut it out of their hearts a knife...can't escape. They're still just Jews.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What? Excuse me?...  You're kidding, right?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Do you know Rabbi Stanley Nadelman? He used to be at Congregation Beth Elohim in Ozone Park...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who? How would I know him?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: He says you were bar mitzvahed there, in March 1988.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You believe that? And you call yourself a reporter?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: So you're saying it's not true.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Look at me.  DO I look Jewish?  Look...

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Were you ever bar mitzvahed anywhere else?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Do you know who you're fucking with here?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: That's what I'm trying to find out, Danny. Who am I fucking with here?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Listen to me....

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Why would Nadelman lie?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: To discredit me. Because I know who they are. Look, I thought I explained it to you. Those people can say or do anything. And they will. It's all narrative to them, it's... Are you going to print what this guy said?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Give me a reason not to.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's slander. It's reckless disregard. I'll sue you and your fucking Jew paper.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Does that mean you deny what he says is true? Yes or no.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: But if the Jews are strengthened by hate, wouldn't this "destruction" you speak of -- by love or by any other means -- in fact make them more powerful than they are already?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes. Infinitely more. They would become as God.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Did you kill Ilio Manzetti?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Two days ago you addressed a Nazi rally. Last week you went to a Torah study group.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What were you, following me?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: How do you reconcile the two?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't. Look, stay out of what you don't understand.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Explain it so I can.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You work for the New York Times. Your whole job in life is not to understand things like me.

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: I don't think you know what you are.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, and what are you? A Times man? A Presbyterian? Impotent? A prick?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: Who killed Manzetti?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: If I tell you, will you pull the story? Not write about me?

turns.speaker: GUY
turns.text: It's too late.... If I didn't, somebody else would.  Yom Kippur starts at sundown. Will you go to synagogue?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Get the fuck away from me.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I always won.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: The arguments, anyway.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Why did you come tonight? To see me?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: To hear them read Torah.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I thought you hated Torah.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That doesn't mean I don't like hearing it.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Point out all the lies and fucked-up thinking.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: You know the joke: a Jew's shipwrecked on a desert island. When they rescue him, they see he's built two synagogues. They say, for vhat do you need two synagogues? He says, vun to pray in, and vun I'd never set foot in so long as I live, so help me God.  You pray in the one you'd never set foot in...and vice versa.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't help what I think.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: This is me.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Tell me about Lina Moebius.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How did you...?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I work in the DA's office. You go to those meetings, half the people there are informants.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You mean the Times guy?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Which Times guy?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: With the shoes... There was more than one?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: You're telling me you killed him? You? Killed him? Bullshit. What kind of gun did you use?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: A forty-five.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: It was a nine millimeter.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: So are you... But they'll believe you....  Lina Moebius is saying the whole thing was your idea. That you proposed it in a meeting at her house.  Ah, Jesus, Danny... What were you thinking? Are you glad Manzetti's dead? Do you really want to kill Jews? You want to kill me?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I was just talking. I -- look, I can't help what I think.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: All right, what if all along you were actually infiltrating the Nazis -- to expose them....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: But I wasn't.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: And only talked about killing Manzetti to convince them you were an anti-Semite. If you'd had any idea somebody would take it seriously, you never would have said it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't say that.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Think about your father. Your sister.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The truth doesn't mean anything to you, does it?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Danny, I'm trying to -- save you.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Fucking kike.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: You shut up. Who do you think you are?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: There's a bomb here. It's going to go off at seven-thirty.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How did you get the fucking number?

turns.speaker: LINDA'S VOICE
turns.text: I want you to say kaddish for her. It's the only thing she asked from us....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I don't do that.

turns.speaker: LINDA'S VOICE
turns.text: You do it on the inside....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't tell me what I --

turns.speaker: LINDA'S VOICE
turns.text: ...I want you to do it on the outside, too.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: LINDA'S VOICE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Lina Moebius. And you are...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Daniel Balint.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Balint?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's German.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: What part of Germany are you people from?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: From the Rhineland originally.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Are you with the FBI, Mr. Balint?... Or any other law enforcement agency?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I was going to ask you the same thing.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Without blood -- a willingness to spill it -- there's no real power, no authority.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Curtis is afraid you'll marginalize us.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We're already marginal. We are saying what no one else has the guts to say. Isn't that precisely our appeal?

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: So what Jew would you kill first?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Ilio Manzetti...former ambassador to France. Managing partner at Damon, Schwarzchild.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Do you feel you're making progress here?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You mean Ilio Manzetti?

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Forget Manzetti.... Take on something simple. Something you can actually accomplish.  Maybe he'd be more valuable in the city.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: How have things been going?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: We want to talk to you about something....  We're about to launch an aboveground, intellectually serious fascist movement.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Hello...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Lina... It's happening. Tonight.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: What is happening?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Beth Shalom. Like you wanted.

turns.speaker: LINA
turns.text: Beth Shalom? What are you talking about? Who is this...?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Lina, you said if I was going to plant a bomb, I should --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about chicken?

turns.speaker: FIRST WAITER
turns.text: That's meat.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Bible only says don't seethe a kid in its mother's milk. But chickens don't give milk.

turns.speaker: FIRST WAITER
turns.text: Look, you want cheese, go someplace else.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: But it's stupid, right? You admit it's stupid.

turns.speaker: FIRST WAITER
turns.text: No, I don't admit it's stupid.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You can have chicken with eggs but not with milk. Why is that?

turns.speaker: FIRST WAITER
turns.text: I'm not here to talk about religious law, if you don't like --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: But you already talked about it: you said it's not stupid. Why isn't it stupid?

turns.speaker: FIRST WAITER
turns.text: Steve...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Steve's going to explain it.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I just came to get some stuff. I'll be out in five minutes.  He doesn't want me around.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: He's going to die.  He won't take his medicine. He eats dairy. He probably still smokes when I'm not around.  I asked him to come live with us. Alex offered to share his room, unsolicited.... But he didn't want to be any trouble.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then he couldn't be bitter about living alone.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why deprive him of his greatest pleasure?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Ah, Jesus Christ, Danny, how can you wear that thing?... You know what it means? To your people...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They're not my people....

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Tell it to Hitler.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Oh, he decides? Hitler's the chief rabbi now?...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Is this because of those kids who used to beat you up?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What kids?...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: The Polacks? From Sacred Heart?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Nobody ever beat me up.  Look, Linda, there're fifty reasons. Even if you knew them all, there'd be another fifty you didn't know.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Do you know them?  I made him some noodles for dinner. You can heat them up and --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I've got to get back to the --

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You can heat them up and eat with him.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Hello...?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Daniel Balint? My name's Guy Danielsen. I'm a reporter with the New York Times.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: New York Times...?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I'm doing a piece on right-wing groups, post Oklahoma City. I hear you're an important figure in those circles. You have a lot of interesting ideas....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who told you that?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Isn't it true?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, it's...yeah, it's true, but... how'd you get this number?... No, not here... Maybe Sunday? There's a place off Queens Blvd. Near the courthouse...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who knows what that is?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: A Jewish prayer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can anybody imagine why I would say a Jewish prayer?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Which was his room?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Number ten.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Where's Mrs. Moebius?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Her place is down the road. But she just comes out for weekends sometimes.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: That was unbelievable what you did to Lucas. The guy's an animal.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You could do it.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Get out of here....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You look right through him. He's there, but there's something on the other side of him that you want. It's all you want. And whatever's in the way doesn't matter.... Then it's easy.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Which one were you aiming at?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The mother.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Green dot -- shotgun powder. For pipe bombs.  A guy in a lumberyard gave it to me. A donation to the cause.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Shut up. Fuck you....

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Open it up.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Here...

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: This will be a different kind of device.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That damn thing. You know how it made me look...?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Danny. It won't happen again. I'm going to use a brand-new power cell. Plus we'll have a back-up timer.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I've gotta kill some Jews, Kyle. I'm serious. I'm always talking about it. This time it's gotta happen.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: It will.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: What about Drake, did he ever show up?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: No, it's weird, man. Nobody knows where he went.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: That's all we've got left.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It'll be enough if we use it right.  Okay, the service'll go about another hour. Say an hour for the janitors, then one more just to be safe... We'll go in at midnight.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Didn't you get anything?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm not hungry.... Come on, let's drive around.... We don't want to be spotted here.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Oh, what is this shit?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Keep driving. Don't slow down.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Christ...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Not too fast.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: You said they didn't have night guards.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: They don't. I checked twenty times.... Somebody must have talked.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Who even knew?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mrs. Moebius.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Why? Why would she?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The Manzetti thing must have scared her. She thinks she'll get implicated.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: So what do we do with the device?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Take a right on 59th...  We'll put it someplace else.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I have an idea....

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: If I went back to the lumberyard, the guy'd give me all the dynamite I wanted. Untraceable, you wouldn't -- need to...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, it has to be tomorrow. You won't get this many of them in here for another year. It'll be fine.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: It's not going to be fine. It's --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Just do it.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: When do you want it to go off?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Seven-thirty tomorrow evening.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: So that's what? Nineteen thirty minutes...what time is it now...

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: Jeez, it's been since, what, Kenny's wedding.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, uh... So how are you? What's going on?

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: I'm in the rabbinic program at JTS...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: JTS...?

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: What about you? What are you doing? Something strange, I bet.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm in a kind of...underground...thing.

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: Are you an artist?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, no... Not that kind of... underground. More a private... business. Private.

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: You remember Miriam....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, hey, how're you doing...

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: She's at Yale Law -- interning with the district attorney...  We're getting married next spring. In Israel.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Wow, that's uh...great...

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: Listen, Danny, you can't just barge in and --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Shut up...

turns.speaker: STUART
turns.text: Danny, listen, people expect me to daven; they don't want someone they don't know -- leading their prayers.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Get out of my way.

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: Lie on your stomach and come up on your elbows.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: You want to kill a Jew. I already did.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Who'd you kill?

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: Four. But no one this important.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How did you know they were Jews?

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: I can tell....

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DRAKE
turns.text: I was a Jew in a previous life.
